pr_title: NMS-12568: Add SystemExcecuteMonitor example into docs

timeline.message: NMS-12568: Add ExcecutionMonitor example into docs
NMS-12568: Add ExcecutionMonitor example into docs
NMS-12568: Add ExcecutionMonitor example into docs

timeline.bodyText:
I'm not clear on the meaning of "before the script exists". Does this mean before creating the script, or before the script runs? I have made a suggestion based on it meaning "before the script runs". Please revise if you mean something different. How does one set a reasonable output, and what would "reasonable" be? I'm also not sure what "event reason" means.

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            NOTE: It is recommended to set reasonable output before the script exists, because the output will be added into the event reason.
          
          
            
            NOTE: We recommend setting reasonable output before the script runs, because the output will be added into the event reason.
timeline.author: Bonrob2
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -33,6 +33,8 @@ If the banner is not available in the output the status is determined as down.
 
 The parameter `args` supports variable replacement for the following set of variables.
 
+NOTE: It is recommended to set reasonable output before the script exists, because the output will be added into the event reason.

replies.bodyText: But now that I reread it, I think we should give that hint. But where? In the the table of the banner parameter description? As note as above or maybe in the example?
replies.author: mfuhrmann

replies.bodyText: I think the note is fine here, but just needs to be clarified. "what is reasonable output" and they are setting it before they create the script or before it runs?
replies.author: Bonrob2
